data.title: 11 Korean Webtoons For Beginners
data.meta_description: Learning Korean can be challenging, especially if you want some reading materials. To help you, here's a list of amazing Korean webtoons.
data.meta_site_name: The blog for language lovers | Lingopie.com
data.text:
Annyeonghaseyo (안녕하세요)! It's no secret that the Korean language can be a challenging language to learn, and it's only natural that you'll need to have the right resource material to help you progress.

You probably know by now that watching K-Dramas is a great way to help you improve your listening skills and learning vocabulary. If you need some tips on what to watch, check out our awesome Best Kdramas to watch on Netflix post.

But what about your reading and writing skills? Many Korean learners struggle to find written content online to assist them with learning Korean. Fortunately, Korean webtoons are a great way to access content in writing. They can be used as an effective tool for learning Korean in a way that is not only fun but also engaging.

In this post, you'll find some of the best Korean webtoons online.

And, to make yours an all-around language learning experience, why not check us out at Lingopie? We're an innovative platform to study Korean with TV shows and movies.

What are Korean Webtoons?

Korean webtoons are a form of manga (manhwa) that is native to South Korea and that is only available online. Webtoons are essentially South Korean comics that come in digital form only.

Korean webtoons differ from Japanese comics in that they're more colorful and more visually intense.

Webtoons come in a very convenient form, which is ideal for language learning. You can read webtoons online on your phone, just by scrolling down, so there's no need to turn any pages.

Where to find Korean Webtoons

You can find webtoons on the Naver and Daum apps. The Naver webtoon app is where most popular webtoon artists publish their work.

Naver's webtoons are more appropriate for beginners too, whilst Daum is more suitable for intermediate learners.

An interesting fact is that Daum is also owned by the same company that owns KakaoTalk, a messaging app that's popular in South Korea.

Benefits of Learning the Korean Language with Webtoons

💡

Reading webtoons will help you to learn everyday life expressions, and have fun while doing so! Being entertained will help optimize your learning.

You can learn about language and Korean culture by studying how webtoon characters react in a range of situations. In addition, you'll get a sense of how native Korean speakers actually speak in daily life.

Apart from their practicality, Korean webtoons are an effective form of language learning content, since the text is accompanied by images.

You can follow the story visually, whilst you decipher the meaning of the words. This way, you'll learn how to read Hangul.

You can also find different genres and material for different levels and vocabulary.

Ultimately, it's an entertaining way to become familiar with the Korean alphabet even if you're not a fan of anime and manga.

How to Learn Korean with Webtoons

Actively or passively

If you choose to just sit back and read the stories for fun as a form of light reading, you'll be learning passively, which means that your brain will absorb the vocabulary, grammar, and sentence structures subconsciously.

If you'd like to turn your reading session into an active learning experience, you'll write down new words, or even a whole sentence that may be useful, and you'll consciously work on it by looking it up.

Check out the English version if you're at a beginner level

If you're just starting on your path to learning Korean, then you might want to check out the English translation of the webtoon stories you decide to read.

However, don't rely too much on the English version as you progress so that you don't stunt your growth.

Don't just pick the first webtoon you see

Once you improve, you can start to search for more complex storylines. As a Korean learner, being strategic about which webtoons to read can take you a long way.

Be sure to start by reading webtoons that are easier to follow and that employ simple daily conversations that will help you to understand the story.

Look up the meaning of new Korean words and phrases

If you've decided to make the most out of your language learning experience and make your study session an active one, you can look up the meaning of what you've written down so far, so you can consolidate your new vocabulary.

Moreover, you can also study and adopt certain sentences, expressions, and phrases so as to incorporate them into your own speech. This will help you to communicate like native Korean speakers.

Take your time with each episode

How long you spend on each chapter will determine how much you can get out of the webtoon linguistically. So, be sure to go in-depth with each story.

Choosing webtoons that are collections of short stories will be helpful to do this.

The Best Webtoons to Learn Korean

Now let's check out the list of Korean webtoons we've put together as a resource to help you organize and plan your Korean studies.

1. Noblesse "노블레스"

Available on Naver Webtoons, "Noblesse" is one of the most popular webtoons you'll find online. Noblesse Rai, the main character in this story is a boy who joins a high school.

However, he's not just a high school student, he's actually a nobleman who was born 820 years ago and re-enters contemporary society upon waking.

How did he get here? Read through as you find out the secrets of his life and how he's traveled in time!

2. Lookism "외모지상주의"

"Lookism" is a critique of modern society and its obsession with appearance and looks. The word itself represents the act of judging someone based on what they look like.

This webtoon is about a Korean boy who has been bullied for most of his life due to being considered unattractive and uncool. Suddenly, he wakes up in the body of an attractive man.

He can now set out to achieve what he had always wanted, but at what cost? And what does that mean about the society we live in?

3. Tower of God "신의 탑"

Another Naver webtoon, "Tower God" is about a boy named Twenty-Fifth Bam who follows his only friend, a girl named Rachel, into a mystical structure called the Tower.

Distraught due to her departure, he must go after her no matter what! Inside the Tower, there are doors to different environments and floors that house other species.

The higher up they go, the better the living conditions they'll find. However, in order to ascend, they must overcome increasingly difficult challenges...

4. Will You Marry Me? "윌유메리미"

The next webtoon is a beginner-level Korean webtoon that tells a realistic story. It is a great resource for studying Korean and it will expose you to the Busan dialect.

This webtoon is in a diary format and tells the story of a couple named Mary and Will who have a 12-year age gap. The pair are in a long-distance relationship since one lives in Busan and the other one lives in Seoul.

By reading this webtoon, you'll read about their story, from when they met to when they get married.

5. Swimming Class for Mermaids "인어를 위한 수영교실"

Also found on Naver Webtoons, this romantic comedy follows two main characters: a mermaid and her high school friend, and a swimming athlete.

This webtoon is easy to read and suitable for beginners.

6. JoJo Comics "조조코믹스"

"JoJo Comics" is also found on Naver Webtoons. It's fairly easy to understand and very funny! It's recent and has become quite popular.

This webtoon is about a couple of office workers who are complete polar opposites in many aspects, but that share a common inner conflict with the other. They both struggle with their past and future selves.

7. Yumi’s Cells "유미의 세포들"

This Korean webtoon employs biology-related vocabulary which may be more challenging to understand at first.

However, if you stick with it, you won't regret it! The story follows Yumi and her cells. Yes, you read that correctly!

In this webtoon, you see how the outside world affects Yumi's body and how her cells react to their environment. This webtoon has many great Korean words to add to your vocabulary.

8. Honey Blood "허니 블러드"

Synopsis: Nae-rim, the daughter of a shaman, is an outcast in her classroom. During a field trip, her bullies force her to enter a deserted church. Inside, she encounters a vampire who is on a quest to find a witch he vowed to protect. In exchange for her help, he asks for her blood to fulfill his desire to become human.

9. True Beauty "여신강림"

True Beauty tells the story of a high school girl who masters the art of makeup to transform herself into a "goddess" at school. The webtoon explores themes of beauty standards, self-esteem, and the pressures of societal expectations. As the protagonist juggles her dual identity, she navigates friendships, romance, and her own self-worth.

10. Marry My husband "내 남편과 결혼해줘"

"Marry My Husband" is a gripping romance and revenge webtoon that follows the life of a woman who, after discovering her husband’s infidelity, dies and is mysteriously sent back in time. Determined to change her fate, she sets out to rewrite her past and find true love, all while planning to expose her unfaithful husband.

11. Death Game "이제 곧 죽습니다"

"Death's Game" follows the story of Choi Yee-jae, a young man who, after battling unemployment for seven years, decides to end his life. However, his attempt attracts the attention of Death, who is displeased with Yee-jae's disregard for the value of life. As punishment, Death forces Yee-jae to participate in a twisted game where he must experience reincarnation and die twelve times before facing eternal damnation.

FAQs About Learning Korean Through Webtoons

What is the most popular Korean webtoon?

The most popular Korean webtoon can vary depending on trends and personal preferences. However, "True Beauty" by Yaongyi is consistently ranked as one of the top webtoons due to its engaging storyline and relatable themes. It has gained immense popularity both in Korea and internationally.

What are webtoons called in Korea?

In Korea, webtoons are called "웹툰" (webtun), a portmanteau of the words "web" and "cartoon." This term refers to digital comics published online, often serialized in a format optimized for scrolling on smartphones and computers.

Is Naver Webtoon free?

Yes, Naver Webtoon, known as "LINE Webtoon" in English, offers many webtoons for free. Readers can access a vast library of webtoons across various genres. While most content is free, some premium episodes or additional features may require payment.

Can you practice Korean by reading webtoons?

Absolutely! Reading webtoons is a great way to practice Korean. Webtoons provide context through visuals and dialogue, making it easier to understand and learn new vocabulary and expressions. They also offer insights into Korean culture, slang, and everyday language used by native speakers.

Which webtoons will help me study Korean, and what are some tips for vocabulary?

Several webtoons can aid in studying Korean, such as "True Beauty," "Honey Blood," "Marry My Husband," and "Yumi Cells" These webtoons offer diverse dialogue and cultural contexts. Here are some tips for vocabulary learning:

Take notes: Jot down new words and phrases you encounter while reading.

Use a dictionary: Look up unfamiliar words and understand their meanings.

Repetition: Revisit webtoon episodes to reinforce vocabulary and grammar.

Context clues: Use the illustrations and storyline to infer the meanings of unknown words.

Practice speaking: Read dialogues out loud to improve pronunciation and fluency.

Summing up: Learning Korean with Webtoons

Since it can be challenging to find written content in the Korean language, we've summed up the best Korean webtoons available for you to work on your reading and writing skills in a fun and exciting way!

💡

Dive into the culture of South Korea through the world of webtoons by reading some of the comics we've recommended! The vast array of webtoon stories available makes it a great resource to study Korean.

You can find Korean webtoons online really easily. The two main platforms are Naver Webtoons and Daum, yet you can also find other options online.

Studying Korean has never been this accessible and practical.
